column1: 25. However, when  I reflect on the seriousness of the charges and consider the
surrounding circumstances, I find myself also inclined to order a retrial. It is
essential to recognise that justice must not only be served but must also be
perceived  as  just  by  all  parties  involved.  The  seriousness  of  the  offences,
combined  with  specific  factors  that  may  have  influenced  the  original  trial,
suggests that proceeding with a retrial is not only warranted but necessary.
